On Tuesday 30 November, the Ministry of Education announced the postponement of the return to school for those schools whose students had not returned to the classroom since the beginning of the pandemic due to the new variant of the coronavirus.    The postponement of dates implied that it will not be until 7 February 2022 that the centres of the Sierra-Amazonian system will return to 100% attendance, while those of the Coastal-Galapagos system will do so on 3 May, for the new 2022-2023 school year, which means that the latter will continue to be virtual until then.    About 48% of educational establishments nationwide are already working in face-to-face classes with reduced seating capacity, which represents around 675,193 students.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211202004342/https://www.elcomercio.com/tendencias/sociedad/unicef-lamenta-coe-reapertura-escuelas-omicron.html
